page.title: 20LOCAL CHURCH HISTORY
page.content:
{SHANGTON CHURCH
Shangton is a very small village consisting of a few scattered houses. The church lies outside the village overlooking the site of the original abandoned village. St. Nicholas's church was built mainly in the fourteenth century although the porch is said to be much older. There is a story that a candle was lit in the tiny windows at the west end of the church to guide the villagers the half mile or so to the church on winter evenings. It is also said that the village was deserted due to the plague.
